info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 27 at 11:59PM CDT until March 28 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
FFWBRO
The National Weather Service in Brownsville has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Cameron County in deep south Texas...
* Until 245 AM CDT.
* At 1159 PM CDT, Emergency management reported multiple high-profile water rescues ongoing with flooded frontage roads from Santa Rosa to Combes and northern Harlingen. Between 5 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Western to Northwestern Cameron County. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Harlingen, Santa Rosa, Palm Valley, Primera, Combes, Doctor Hesiquio Rodriguez Elementary School, Wilson Elementary School, Palm Valley Police Department, Combes Community Center, Dishman Elementary School, Moises Vela Middle School, Harlingen High School South, Lamar Elementary School, Grand Acres, Santa Rosa High School, Harlingen City Reservoir, Harligen Municipal Golf Course, Tierra Bonita, Santa Rosa Police Department and Harlingen Public Library.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR WESTERN TO NORTHWESTERN CAMERON COUNTY
NWS: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY this area til 2:45 AM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY is in effect for this area until 2:45 AM CDT. This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR WESTERN TO NORTHWESTERN CAMERON COUNTY
SNM: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 2:45 AM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 2:45 AM CDT. Esta es una situacion extremadamente peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
